Ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery, cardamom powder, oil for frying
Procedure: 1. Soak raw rice in water for a few hours, then drain and dry it. 2. Grind the rice into a fine powder. 3. Mix rice flour, powdered jaggery, cardamom powder, and water to form a smooth dough. 4. Shape the dough into small flat discs. 5. Deep fry in oil until golden brown.

Ingredients: Potatoes, cauliflower, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, spices, oil
Procedure: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter. 2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 5. Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. 6. Add diced potatoes and cauliflower florets. 7. Cover and cook until vegetables are tender. 8. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Ingredients: Potatoes, green peas, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, spices, oil
Procedure: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter. 2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 5. Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. 6. Add diced potatoes and green peas. 7. Cover and cook until potatoes are tender. 8. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Ingredients: Potatoes, fenugreek leaves, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, spices, oil
Procedure: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter. 2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 5. Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. 6. Add diced potatoes and fenugreek leaves. 7. Cover and cook until potatoes are tender. 8. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Ingredients: Potatoes, bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, spices, oil
Procedure: 1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter. 2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 5. Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. 6. Add diced potatoes and bell pepper slices. 7. Cover and cook until vegetables are tender. 8. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Ingredients: Potatoes, onions, green chilies, ginger, coriander leaves, spices, oil
Procedure: 1. Boil and mash potatoes, then mix with chopped onions, green chilies, ginger, coriander leaves, and spices. 2. Shape the mixture into flat patties. 3. Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the patties until golden brown on both sides. 4. Serve hot with chutney or yogurt.

Ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery, sesame seeds, cardamom powder, oil for frying
Procedure: 1. Soak rice overnight, then drain and grind into a fine powder. 2. Mix powdered jaggery, cardamom powder, sesame seeds, and a little water with the rice flour to form a dough. 3. Roll out small balls of dough and flatten them into discs. 4. Deep fry in oil until golden brown. 5. Drain excess oil and let them cool before serving.

Ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery, cardamom powder, oil for frying
Procedure: 1. Soak raw rice in water for a few hours, then drain and dry it. 2. Grind the rice into a fine powder. 3. In a pan, melt jaggery with water to form a syrup. 4. Mix rice flour, jaggery syrup, and cardamom powder to form a smooth dough. 5. Roll out small balls of dough and flatten them into discs. 6. Deep fry in oil until golden brown. 7. Drain excess oil and let them cool before serving.

Ingredients: Gram flour (besan), ghee, sugar, cardamom powder, nuts
Procedure: 1. Roast gram flour in ghee until aromatic. 2. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and nuts. 3. Mix well and let it cool slightly. 4. Shape into round laddus while still warm. 5. Store in an airtight container once cooled.

Ingredients: Milk, sugar, saffron, cardamom powder, nuts (like almonds, pistachios)
Procedure: 1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan and let it simmer on low heat, stirring occasionally until it reduces to about half its original volume. 2. Add sugar, saffron, and cardamom powder to the reduced milk and continue to cook until the mixture thickens further. 3. Remove from heat and let it cool. 4. Garnish with chopped nuts before serving.

Ingredients: All-purpose flour (maida), yogurt, baking powder, salt, sugar, oil for frying
Procedure: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, yogurt, baking powder, salt, sugar, and a little water to make a soft dough. 2. Knead the dough well and let it rest for about 2 hours, covered with a damp cloth. 3. After resting, divide the dough into small balls and roll them out into circles. 4. Heat oil in a deep frying pan and fry the rolled-out dough circles until they puff up and turn golden brown on both sides. 5. Drain excess oil on paper towels before serving.

Ingredients: Okra (bhindi), onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, garam masala, salt, oil
Procedure: 1. Wash and dry the okra, then chop it into pieces. 2. Heat oil in a pan and sauté chopped onions until golden brown. 3. Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped green chilies, and sauté until fragrant. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 5. Add coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, garam masala, and salt, and mix well. 6. Add chopped okra to the pan and cook until tender. 7. Garnish with cilantro before serving.

Ingredients: Basmati rice, chicken or meat, onions, tomatoes, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, spices (like cloves, cardamom, cinnamon), saffron, nuts, cilantro, mint leaves
Procedure: 1. Marinate the chicken or meat with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and spices for a few hours. 2. In a separate pot, cook basmati rice with whole spices until partially done. 3. In a large heavy-bottomed pot, layer marinated meat, partially cooked rice, fried onions, saffron-infused milk, and chopped nuts, repeating the layers as needed. 4. Cover and cook on low heat until the meat is tender and rice is fully cooked. 5. Garnish with cilantro and mint leaves before serving.

Ingredients: Chickpea flour (besan), water, baking soda, turmeric, salt, oil for frying
Procedure: 1. Mix chickpea flour with water, baking soda, turmeric, and salt to form a smooth batter. 2. Heat oil in a pan and pour the batter through a perforated ladle or a slotted spoon to form tiny droplets (boondi) into the hot oil. 3. Fry the boondi until they turn golden brown and crispy. 4. Drain excess oil and let them cool. 5. Store in an airtight container for later use or use immediately in recipes like raita or as a snack.

Ingredients: Chicken, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, spices (like garam masala, chili powder, turmeric), tomatoes, cream, butter, fenugreek leaves (kasuri methi)
Procedure: 1. Marinate chicken pieces in a mixture of yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and spices for a few hours. 2. Grill or roast the marinated chicken until cooked through. 3. In a separate pan, heat butter and sauté chopped tomatoes until soft. 4. Add cream, cooked chicken, and fenugreek leaves to the pan and simmer until the sauce thickens. 5. Garnish with fresh cream and serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: Black rice (Chak Hao), milk, sugar, cardamom powder, nuts (like almonds, cashews, pistachios), saffron
Procedure: 1. Wash the black rice and soak it in water for a few hours. 2. Drain the soaked rice and cook it with milk in a saucepan until soft and creamy. 3. Add sugar, cardamom powder, saffron, and chopped nuts to the cooked rice and mix well. 4. Simmer for a few more minutes until the kheer thickens to the desired consistency. 5. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly before serving.

Ingredients: Paneer (Indian cottage cheese), sugar, milk, saffron, cardamom powder, nuts (like pistachios, almonds)
Procedure: 1. Knead paneer with a little sugar until smooth and pliable. 2. Shape the paneer mixture into cylindrical or oval shapes. 3. Boil milk with sugar, saffron, and cardamom powder in a wide pan. 4. Gently add the paneer shapes to the boiling milk and cook until they are soft and spongy. 5. Remove the cham cham from the milk and let them cool. 6. Garnish with chopped nuts before serving.

Ingredients: Chickpeas, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, spices (like coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, garam masala), cilantro, lemon juice
Procedure: 1. Soak chickpeas overnight, then cook until tender. 2. In a pan, heat oil and sauté chopped onions until golden brown. 3. Add ginger-garlic paste, chopped tomatoes, and green chilies, and cook until soft. 4. Add spices and salt, and cook until the mixture is fragrant. 5. Add cooked chickpeas and a little water if needed, and simmer until the flavors meld together. 6. Garnish with chopped cilantro and a splash of lemon juice before serving.

Ingredients: Whole wheat flour (atta) , Water ,Salt (optional)
Procedure: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour and salt (if using). 2. Gradually add water and knead the mixture into a soft dough. 3. Divide the dough into small balls. 4. Roll out each ball into a thin, round shape using a rolling pin. 5. Heat a tawa (flat skillet) over medium heat. 6. Place the rolled-out dough on the hot tawa and cook until bubbles start to appear. 7. Flip the chapati and cook the other side until brown spots appear. 8. Remove from the tawa and brush with ghee or butter (optional). Serve hot.

Ingredients: Chhena (fresh paneer) , Milk ,Sugar -,Cardamom powder , Saffron strands (optional)
Procedure: 1. Crumble or grate the chhena and set aside. 2. In a pan, heat milk and bring it to a boil. 3. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands (if using) to the milk and stir until the sugar dissolves. 4. Add the crumbled chhena to the milk mixture and cook on low heat, stirring continuously. 5. Cook until the mixture thickens and attains a kheer-like consistency. 6. Remove from heat and let it cool. 7. Garnish with chopped nuts (optional) before serving.

Ingredients: Chicken pieces ,Yogurt ,Onion ,Ginger-garlic paste ,Green chilies ,Cashew nuts , Poppy seeds (khus khus) , Cardamom pods , Cinnamon stick ,Cloves ,Bay leaf , Coriander powder ,Cumin powder - Red chili powder - Turmeric powder - Garam masala powder - Fresh cream - Oil - Salt
Procedure: 1. Marinate chicken pieces in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and salt for about 30 minutes. 2. In a blender, grind onion, green chilies, cashew nuts, and poppy seeds into a smooth paste. 3. Heat oil in a pan, add whole spices (cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, bay leaf), and sauté until fragrant. 4. Add the ground paste and sauté until golden brown. 5. Add coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. 6. Cook the masala until oil separates. 7. Add marinated chicken pieces and cook until tender. 8. Finish with garam masala powder and fresh cream. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Chicken breast or thigh pieces , Yogurt , Lemon juice , Ginger-garlic paste ,Red chili powder , Turmeric powder , Garam masala powder,Salt , Oil
Procedure: 1. In a bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, and salt to make the marinade. 2. Add chicken pieces to the marinade and coat well. 3. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. 4. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). 5. Thread the marinated chicken pieces onto skewers and place them on a baking tray lined with aluminum foil. 6. Brush the chicken pieces with oil. 7. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and slightly charred. 8. Serve hot with mint chutney and lemon wedges.

Ingredients: Chicken breast or thigh pieces , Yogurt ,Lemon juice , Ginger-garlic paste , Red chili powder ,Turmeric powder ,Garam masala powder , Tomato puree , Onion , Butter , Oil ,Fresh cream , Kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves) - Salt
Procedure: 1. Marinate chicken pieces in yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, and salt for about 2 hours. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add marinated chicken pieces, and cook until browned. Remove and set aside. 3. In the same pan, add butter and sauté chopped onions until golden brown. 4. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until fragrant. 5. Add tomato puree, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates. 6. Add cooked chicken pieces and simmer for 10-15 minutes. 7. Finish with fresh cream and kasuri methi. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: Jaggery or sugar , Peanuts or sesame seeds or mixed nuts , Ghee or oil
Procedure: 1. Heat ghee or oil in a pan and roast peanuts or sesame seeds until golden brown. 2. Remove from heat and set aside. 3. In the same pan, melt jaggery or sugar until it reaches a two-string consistency. 4. Add roasted peanuts or sesame seeds to the melted jaggery or sugar and mix well. 5. Pour the mixture onto a greased surface or plate and spread it evenly with a spatula. 6. Let it cool and harden. 7. Once cooled, break it into pieces and store in an airtight container.

Ingredients: For Baati: Whole wheat flour (atta), Semolina (sooji), Ghee, Salt, Water - For Daal: Pigeon peas (tuvar dal), Water, Turmeric powder, Salt, Ghee, Cumin seeds, Asafoetida, Ginger, Green chilies, Red chili powder, Coriander powder, Garam masala, Lemon juice - For Churma: Whole wheat flour (atta), Semolina (sooji), Ghee, Jaggery, Cardamom powder, Water
Procedure: 1. For Baati: Mix whole wheat flour, ghee, and salt. Gradually add water to make a stiff dough. Shape into small balls and bake in a preheated oven until golden brown. 2. For Daal: Pressure cook mixed lentils with onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Temper with spices in hot oil. 3. For Churma: Mix wheat flour and ghee, then add water to make a stiff dough. Shape into small balls and fry until golden brown. Crush the fried balls and mix with powdered jaggery, cardamom powder, and chopped nuts.

Ingredients: For Puri: Whole wheat flour, salt, water. For Daal: Toor dal, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, coriander leaves, salt, oil.
Procedure: 1. For Puri: Mix whole wheat flour, salt, and water to make a stiff dough. Divide into small balls and roll out into thin discs. Deep fry until puffed and golden brown. 2. For Daal: Cook toor dal with onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Temper with spices in hot oil. Serve hot with puris.

Ingredients: Whole black lentils (urad dal), kidney beans (rajma), onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, butter, cream, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, kasuri methi, salt, oil
Procedure: 1. Soak whole black lentils and kidney beans overnight. Pressure cook with onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt until soft. 2. Mash the cooked dal slightly and add butter, cream, garam masala, and kasuri methi. 3. Simmer on low heat until flavors are well blended. 4. Serve hot with rice or naan.

Ingredients: Split pigeon peas (toor dal), split red lentils (masoor dal), onions, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger, garlic, cumin seeds, mustard seeds, asafoetida, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, coriander leaves, oil, ghee, salt
Procedure: 1. Pressure cook toor dal and masoor dal until soft. 2. Heat oil and ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and asafoetida. 3. Add chopped onions, green chilies, ginger, and garlic. Sauté until onions are golden brown. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 5. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. 6. Add cooked dal and salt. 7. Let it simmer for a few minutes. 8. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Milk, sugar, lemon juice, ghee, cardamom powder
Procedure: 1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan. 2. Add lemon juice to curdle the milk. 3. Strain the curdled milk through a muslin cloth to separate the chenna (paneer). 4. Heat ghee in a pan, add chenna, and cook on low heat until it thickens. 5. Add sugar and cardamom powder. 6. Cook until the mixture leaves the sides of the pan. 7. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly. 8. Shape into small pedhas and let them cool completely before serving.

Ingredients: Milk, basmati rice, sugar, saffron, cardamom powder, chopped nuts (such as almonds, cashews, pistachios)
Procedure: 1. Wash and soak rice for 30 minutes. 2. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan. 3. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the boiling milk. 4. Cook on low heat until the rice is soft and the mixture thickens. Stir occasionally. 5. Add sugar, saffron, and cardamom powder. Mix well. 6. Cook for another 5-10 minutes. 7. Garnish with chopped nuts. Serve hot or chilled.

Ingredients: Bread slices, milk, sugar, ghee, cardamom powder, saffron strands, chopped nuts (such as almonds, cashews, pistachios)
Procedure: 1. Trim the edges of the bread slices and cut them into triangles or squares. 2. Heat ghee in a pan and fry the bread slices until golden brown and crispy. 3. Boil milk in a separate pan and add sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron. 4. Dip the fried bread slices in the sweetened milk mixture for a few seconds. 5. Arrange the soaked bread slices in a serving dish. 6. Garnish with chopped nuts. Serve warm or chilled.

Ingredients: Baby potatoes, yogurt, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, kasuri methi, oil, salt
Procedure: 1. Boil baby potatoes until partially cooked. 2. Heat oil in a pan and fry the potatoes until golden brown. 3. In the same pan, add chopped onions, ginger-garlic paste, and green chilies. Sauté until onions are translucent. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 5. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. 6. Add beaten yogurt and mix well. 7. Add fried potatoes and kasuri methi. 8. Cook on low heat until potatoes are fully cooked and the gravy thickens. 9. Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: Carrots, milk, sugar, ghee, cardamom powder, chopped nuts (such as almonds, cashews, pistachios), raisins
Procedure: 1. Grate the carrots using a grater. 2. Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan and add grated carrots. Sauté for a few minutes. 3. Add milk and cook on low heat until the carrots are soft and the milk is absorbed. Stir occasionally. 4. Add sugar and cardamom powder. Mix well. 5. Continue cooking until the mixture thickens. 6. Add chopped nuts and raisins. Cook for another few minutes. 7. Remove from heat and serve hot or warm.

Ingredients: Rice flour, maida (all-purpose flour), ghee, water, jaggery or sugar
Procedure: 1. Mix rice flour and maida in a bowl. 2. Add melted ghee and mix well. 3. Gradually add water to form a smooth dough. 4. Take a small portion of the dough and roll it into a thin rope. 5. Cut the rope into small pieces. 6. Press each piece against a gavvalu maker or fork to shape it. 7. Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the shaped dough until golden brown and crispy. 8. Drain excess oil and let them cool. 9. In a separate pan, melt jaggery or sugar with a little water to make a syrup. 10. Dip the fried gavvalu in the syrup. 11. Allow them to cool completely before serving.

Ingredients: Maida (all-purpose flour), ghee, milk, sugar, water, cardamom powder, saffron, chopped nuts (such as almonds, pistachios)
Procedure: 1. Prepare a thick batter by mixing maida, ghee, milk, and water. 2. Heat ghee in a deep pan and pour a ladleful of batter into it. 3. Deep fry until golden brown and crispy. 4. Remove from the ghee and drain excess oil. 5. Prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water until it reaches one-string consistency. 6. Dip the fried ghevar into the sugar syrup. 7. Garnish with chopped nuts and saffron. 8. Allow it to cool and set before serving.

Ingredients: Milk powder, all-purpose flour, ghee, baking powder, milk, sugar, water, cardamom powder, saffron, chopped nuts (such as almonds, pistachios)
Procedure: 1. Mix milk powder, all-purpose flour, ghee, and baking powder in a bowl. 2. Gradually add milk to form a smooth dough. 3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into smooth balls. 4. Heat ghee in a pan and fry the dough balls until

Ingredients: Urad dal (black gram split), rice flour, sugar, saffron strands, cardamom powder, oil for frying
Procedure: 1. Soak urad dal in water for 4-5 hours. 2. Drain the water and grind the dal into a smooth batter, adding little water if necessary. 3. Add rice flour, saffron strands, and cardamom powder to the batter. Mix well. 4. Heat oil in a deep pan. 5. Pour the batter into a cloth or piping bag with a small hole. 6. Squeeze the batter into the hot oil in a circular motion to form spiral shapes. 7. Fry until golden brown and crispy. 8. Drain excess oil and soak the imartis in sugar syrup for a few minutes. 9. Remove from the syrup and serve warm.

Ingredients: All-purpose flour, yogurt, water, saffron strands, sugar, cardamom powder, lemon juice, oil for frying
Procedure: 1. Mix all-purpose flour, yogurt, and water to make a smooth batter. Let it ferment for 8-10 hours or overnight. 2. Prepare sugar syrup by boiling water, sugar, saffron, and cardamom powder until it reaches one-string consistency. Add lemon juice to prevent crystallization. 3. Heat oil in a flat-bottomed pan or a jalebi kadai. 4. Pour the batter into a cloth or piping bag with a small hole. 5. Squeeze the batter into the hot oil in a circular motion to form spiral shapes. 6. Fry until golden brown and crisp. 7. Drain excess oil and immediately dip the jalebis in the sugar syrup. Let them soak for a few seconds. 8. Remove from the syrup and serve hot.

Ingredients: For Dough: All-purpose flour, salt, water. For Filling: Yellow moong dal (split yellow lentils), fennel seeds, ginger, green chilies, asafoetida, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, amchur (dry mango powder), oil, salt.
Procedure: 1. Prepare the dough by mixing all-purpose flour, salt, and water. Knead into a smooth dough and let it rest for 15-20 minutes. 2. Meanwhile, prepare the filling by cooking yellow moong dal until soft. Drain excess water and mash slightly. 3. Heat oil in a pan, add fennel seeds, ginger, green chilies, and asafoetida. Sauté for a minute. 4. Add cooked dal, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, amchur, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the mixture is dry. 5. Divide the dough and filling into equal portions. 6. Roll out each portion of dough into a small circle. 7. Place a portion of filling in the center and seal the edges to form a ball. 8. Flatten the balls slightly. 9. Heat oil in a pan for deep frying. 10. Fry the kachoris on medium heat until golden brown and crisp. 11. Serve hot with chutney or curry.

Ingredients: Paneer (cottage cheese), onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, capsicum (bell pepper), coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, kasuri methi, cream, oil, salt
Procedure: 1. Heat oil in a kadai or pan. 2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté until the raw smell disappears. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 5. Add coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. 6. Add chopped capsicum and cook until it is slightly tender. 7. Add paneer cubes and mix gently. 8. Add garam masala and kasuri methi. 9. Pour cream and mix well. 10. Cook for another 2-3 minutes. 11. Garnish with coriander leaves. 12. Serve hot with naan or roti.

Ingredients: For Pakoras: Gram flour (besan), onions, spinach, green chilies, ginger, ajwain (carom seeds), salt, oil for frying. For Kadhi: Yogurt, gram flour, turmeric powder, red chili powder, asafoetida, fenugreek seeds, cumin seeds, mustard seeds, curry leaves, dried red chilies, ginger, garlic, salt, oil.
Procedure: 1. Prepare the pakoras by mixing gram flour, chopped onions, spinach, green chilies, ginger, ajwain, and salt. Add water as needed to make a thick batter. 2. Heat oil in a pan and drop spoonfuls of batter into the hot oil. Fry until golden brown and crisp. Drain excess oil and set aside. 3. For the kadhi, whisk yogurt with gram flour, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. 4. Heat oil in a kadai or pan. Add fenugreek seeds, cumin seeds, mustard seeds, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until fragrant. 5. Add asafoetida, ginger, and garlic. Sauté for a minute. 6. Pour the yogurt mixture into the pan. Add water and mix well. 7. Cook on low heat until the kadhi thickens and raw smell disappears. 8. Add the prepared pakoras and simmer for another 5-7 minutes. 9. Garnish with coriander leaves. 10. Serve hot with rice or roti.

Ingredients: For Dough: Maida (all-purpose flour), ghee, water, salt. For Filling: Grated coconut, jaggery, cardamom powder, chopped nuts (such as almonds, cashews, pistachios), poppy seeds, oil for frying.
Procedure: 1. Prepare the dough by mixing all-purpose flour, ghee, water, and salt. Knead into a smooth dough and let it rest for 15-20 minutes. 2. Meanwhile, prepare the filling by mixing grated coconut, jaggery, cardamom powder, chopped nuts, and poppy seeds. 3. Divide the dough into small balls and roll out each ball into a small circle. 4. Place a portion of filling in the center of each circle and fold it into a semi-circle. 5. Press the edges to seal and create a decorative pattern using a fork or fingers. 6. Heat oil in a pan for deep frying. 7. Fry the kajjikayas on medium heat until golden brown and crisp. 8. Drain excess oil

Ingredients: All-purpose flour, ghee, water, sugar, cardamom powder, oil for frying
Procedure: 1. Mix all-purpose flour and ghee in a bowl until crumbly. 2. Gradually add water to form a stiff dough. 3. Divide the dough into small portions and roll out each portion into a thin circle. 4. Fold the circles into pleats and roll them into a spiral shape. 5. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying. 6. Fry the prepared spirals until golden brown and crisp. 7. Drain excess oil and set aside. 8. In a separate pan, prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar, water, and cardamom powder until it reaches one-string consistency. 9. Dip the fried spirals into the sugar syrup and let them soak for a few minutes. 10. Remove from the syrup and let them cool before serving.

Ingredients: Milk, sugar, lemon juice or vinegar, ghee, cardamom powder, chopped nuts (such as almonds, pistachios)
Procedure: 1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan. 2. Add lemon juice or vinegar to curdle the milk. 3. Strain the curdled milk through a muslin cloth to separate the chenna (paneer). 4. Heat ghee in a pan and add the chenna. Cook on low heat until it thickens. 5. Add sugar and cardamom powder. Mix well. 6. Cook until the mixture thickens further and starts leaving the sides of the pan. 7. Transfer the mixture to a greased plate and spread evenly. 8. Garnish with chopped nuts and let it cool. 9. Once cooled, cut into pieces and serve.

Ingredients: Bitter gourd (karela), onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, amchur (dry mango powder), oil, salt
Procedure: 1. Peel the skin of bitter gourd, slit them lengthwise, and remove the seeds. 2. Cut them into small pieces. 3. Heat oil in a pan, add bitter gourd pieces, and fry until they turn crispy and brown. 4. Remove them from the pan and keep aside. 5. In the same pan, add chopped onions, ginger, garlic, and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown. 6. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. 7. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. 8. Add fried bitter gourd pieces and amchur. Mix well and cook for 5-7 minutes. 9. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

Ingredients: For Koftas: Potatoes, paneer (cottage cheese), corn flour, green chilies, ginger, coriander leaves, salt, oil for frying. For Gravy: Onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, cashew nuts, yogurt, cream, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, kasuri methi, oil, salt.
Procedure: For Koftas: 1. Boil, peel, and mash potatoes. 2. Grate paneer and add it to the mashed potatoes. 3. Add chopped green chilies, ginger, coriander leaves, corn flour, and salt. Mix well and shape into balls. 4. Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the koftas until golden brown. Drain excess oil and set aside. For Gravy: 1. Heat oil in a pan and add chopped onions. Sauté until golden brown. 2. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and cashew nuts. Cook until tomatoes are soft. 4. Allow the mixture to cool and blend it into a smooth paste. 5. Heat oil in a pan and add the paste. Cook for a few minutes. 6. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well. 7. Add beaten yogurt and cook until oil separates. 8. Add cream, garam masala, and kasuri methi. Mix well. 9. Add water to adjust the consistency of the gravy. 10. Simmer for a few minutes. Assembly: 1. Just before serving, add the fried koftas to the gravy. 2. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or naan.

Ingredients: Rice, urad dal (black gram split), fenugreek seeds, salt, oil for greasing. Optional: Chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, grated coconut.
Procedure: 1. Wash and soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds together for 4-6 hours. 2. Grind them into a smooth batter by adding water as needed. 3. Add salt and mix well. 4. Let the batter ferment for 8-10 hours or overnight. 5. Heat a kuzhi paniyaram pan and grease the molds with oil. 6. Pour a spoonful of batter into each mold. 7. Optionally, add chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, and grated coconut on top. 8. Cover and cook on medium heat until the bottom side is golden brown. 9. Flip and cook the other side until done. 10. Remove from the pan and serve hot with chutney or sambar.

Ingredients: Yogurt, water, sugar (optional), salt (optional), cardamom powder (optional), rose water (optional), saffron strands (optional), chopped nuts (such as almonds, pistachios) (optional), mint leaves (optional).
Procedure: 1. In a blender, add yogurt, water, and sugar (if using). 2. Optionally, add salt, cardamom powder, rose water, saffron strands, chopped nuts, and mint leaves. 3. Blend until smooth and frothy. 4. Pour the lassi into serving glasses. 5. Garnish with saffron strands, chopped nuts, and mint leaves. 6. Serve chilled.

Ingredients: Khoya (reduced milk), paneer (cottage cheese), maida (all-purpose flour), sugar, ghee, water, cardamom powder, rose water, oil for frying.
Procedure: 1. Mash khoya and paneer together until smooth. 2. Add maida, cardamom powder, and rose water. Mix well to form a smooth dough. 3. Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into cylindrical or oval shapes. 4. Heat ghee in a pan for deep frying. 5. Fry the shaped ledikeni on low heat until golden brown. 6. Meanwhile, prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water until it reaches one-string consistency. 7. Remove the fried ledikeni from the ghee and dip them into the sugar syrup. 8. Allow them to soak for a few minutes. 9. Remove from the syrup and serve.

Ingredients: For Litti: Whole wheat flour, sattu (roasted gram flour), ajwain (carom seeds), salt, water, ghee. For Chokha: Potatoes, tomatoes, eggplant, onions, green chilies, garlic, ginger, coriander leaves, mustard oil, salt, lemon juice.
Procedure: For Litti: 1. Mix whole wheat flour, sattu, ajwain, salt, and ghee in a bowl. 2. Gradually add water and knead into a stiff dough. 3. Divide the dough into small balls. 4. Flatten each ball and fill it with sattu mixture. 5. Close the edges and shape them into balls again. 6. Bake the littis in a preheated oven or cook them on a tawa until golden brown. 7. Smear ghee on top. For Chokha: 1. Roast potatoes, eggplant, and tomatoes over direct flame until charred. 2. Peel the skin and mash them together. 3. Add chopped onions, green chilies, garlic, ginger, coriander leaves, mustard oil, salt, and lemon juice. 4. Mix well. Serve litti with chokha and enjoy.

Ingredients: Khoya (reduced milk), paneer (cottage cheese), maida (all-purpose flour), sugar, ghee, water, cardamom powder, saffron strands, chopped nuts (such as almonds, pistachios).
Procedure: 1. Mash khoya and paneer together until smooth. 2. Add maida, sugar, cardamom powder, saffron strands, and chopped nuts. Mix well to form a smooth dough. 3. Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into cylindrical or oval shapes. 4. Heat ghee in a pan for deep frying. 5. Fry the shaped lyangchas on low heat until golden brown. 6. Remove from the ghee and drain excess oil. 7. Serve hot or warm.

Ingredients: Fish pieces, mustard oil, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, salt, water, coriander leaves.
Procedure: 1. Clean and wash the fish pieces. 2. Heat mustard oil in a pan. 3. Add chopped onions, ginger, garlic, and green chilies. Sauté until onions are translucent. 4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. 5. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well. 6. Add water and bring it to a boil. 7. Gently add the fish pieces to the boiling gravy. 8. Cover and cook until the fish is cooked through. 9. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with chopped coriander leaves. 10. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Dish: Makki di Roti Sarson da Saag
Ingredients: For Makki di Roti: Makki ka atta (cornmeal), water, salt, ghee. For Sarson da Saag: Mustard greens, spinach, bathua leaves (optional), green chilies, ginger, garlic, onions, tomatoes, cumin seeds, asafoetida, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, salt, ghee.
Procedure: For Makki di Roti: 1. Knead makki ka atta with water and salt to make a soft dough. 2. Divide the dough into small portions and roll out into rotis. 3. Cook the rotis on a hot griddle with ghee until golden brown spots appear on both sides. For Sarson da Saag: 1. Blanch mustard greens, spinach, and bathua leaves in boiling water for 2-3 minutes. 2. Drain and blend into a coarse paste along with green chilies, ginger, and garlic. 3. Heat ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds and asafoetida. 4. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 5. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 6. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. 7. Add the blended greens mixture and cook for 10-15 minutes. 8. Add garam masala and simmer for another few minutes. 9. Serve hot with makki di roti and a dollop of ghee.

Ingredients: Maida (all-purpose flour), semolina (sooji), sugar, fennel seeds, cardamom powder, ripe bananas, milk, water, oil for frying.
Procedure: 1. Mix maida, semolina, sugar, fennel seeds, and cardamom powder in a bowl. 2. Mash ripe bananas and add them to the dry ingredients. 3. Gradually add milk and water to make a smooth batter. 4. Heat oil in a pan for frying. 5. Pour a ladleful of batter into the hot oil to form a small pancake. 6. Fry until golden brown on both sides. 7. Drain excess oil and dip the malapuas in sugar syrup if desired. 8. Serve hot or warm.

Ingredients: Whole wheat flour, gram flour (besan), onion, green chilies, coriander leaves, carom seeds (ajwain), salt, oil.
Procedure: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, gram flour, finely chopped onion, green chilies, coriander leaves, carom seeds, and salt. 2. Gradually add water and knead into a soft dough. 3. Divide the dough into small portions and roll out each portion into a thin circle. 4. Heat a tawa or griddle and place the rolled roti on it. 5. Cook on both sides until golden brown spots appear. 6. Brush with oil or ghee while cooking. 7. Serve hot with any curry or pickle.

Ingredients: Milk, sugar, yogurt (curd), cardamom powder, saffron strands.
Procedure: 1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan until it reduces to half the quantity. 2. Add sugar and continue to cook until the sugar dissolves completely. 3. Allow the milk to cool down to room temperature. 4. Once cooled, add yogurt (curd) to the milk and mix well. 5. Add cardamom powder and saffron strands for flavor. 6. Pour the mixture into earthen pots or any other container. 7. Keep the pots in a warm place for fermentation. 8. After 6-8 hours, refrigerate the mishti doi until chilled. 9. Serve cold as a dessert.

Ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery, coconut, cardamom powder, ghee.
Procedure: For Outer Covering: 1. Heat water in a pan and bring it to a boil. 2. Add rice flour to the boiling water and mix well to form a dough. 3. Remove from heat and allow it to cool slightly. 4. Knead the dough while it is still warm to make it smooth. For Filling: 1. Heat ghee in a pan and add grated coconut. 2. Add jaggery and cook until it melts and blends with coconut. 3. Add cardamom powder for flavor and mix well. 4. Remove from heat and allow the mixture to cool down. Shaping Modak: 1. Take a small portion of the dough and flatten it into a small disc shape. 2. Place a spoonful of the coconut-jaggery filling in the center. 3. Bring the edges together and shape them into a modak. 4. Repeat the process with the remaining dough and filling. Steaming Modak: 1. Grease a steamer plate with ghee and arrange the modaks on it. 2. Steam the modaks for about 10-12 minutes until they are cooked. 3. Remove from the steamer and allow them to cool slightly before serving.

Ingredients: Besan (gram flour), ghee, sugar, water.
Procedure: 1. Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan. 2. Add besan (gram flour) to the ghee and roast on low heat until it turns aromatic and changes color slightly. 3. Meanwhile, in another pan, prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water until it reaches one-string consistency. 4. Slowly add the sugar syrup to the roasted besan while stirring continuously to avoid lumps. 5. Continue cooking and stirring until the mixture thickens and leaves the sides of the pan. 6. Pour the mixture into a greased plate and spread it evenly. 7. Allow it to cool for a few minutes and cut it into pieces while it is still warm. 8. Let it cool completely and then remove the pieces from the plate. 9. Store in an airtight container.

Ingredients: All-purpose flour, yeast, sugar, warm water, yogurt, salt, oil, butter, garlic (optional), coriander leaves (optional).
Procedure: Dough Preparation: 1. In a bowl, mix yeast, sugar, and warm water. Let it rest for 5-10 minutes until frothy. 2. In another bowl, combine all-purpose flour, yogurt, salt, and oil. 3. Add the yeast mixture to the flour and knead into a soft dough. 4. Cover the dough and let it rest in a warm place for 1-2 hours until it doubles in size. Naan Making: 1. Preheat the oven to its highest temperature with a pizza stone or baking sheet inside. 2. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls. 3. Roll out each ball into an oval or teardrop shape. 4. Optionally, sprinkle chopped garlic and coriander leaves on top. 5. Place the rolled naan on the hot pizza stone or baking sheet and bake for 2-3 minutes until puffed up and golden brown. 6. Brush with melted butter and serve hot.

Ingredients: Mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, potatoes, cauliflower), paneer (cottage cheese), cashew nuts, almonds, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, yogurt, cream, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, kasuri methi, oil, ghee, salt.
Procedure: 1. Boil or steam the mixed vegetables until they are partially cooked. 2. Heat oil in a pan and fry paneer cubes until golden brown. Drain and set aside. 3. In the same pan, add ghee and sauté chopped onions until golden brown. 4. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears. 5. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 6. Add cashew nuts and almonds. Cook for a few minutes. 7. Allow the mixture to cool and blend it into a smooth paste. 8. Heat oil in a pan and add the blended paste. 9. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates. 10. Add whisked yogurt and mix well. 11. Add boiled vegetables, paneer, and kasuri methi. Simmer for 5-7 minutes. 12. Add cream and garam masala. Mix gently. 13. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: Spinach (palak), paneer (cottage cheese), onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, cream, oil, ghee, salt.
Procedure: 1. Blanch spinach leaves in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and transfer them to ice-cold water. 2. Blend blanched spinach into a smooth paste. 3. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. 4. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 5. Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies. Sauté for a minute. 6. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 7. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well. 8. Add the spinach puree and cook for 5-7 minutes. 9. Add paneer cubes and garam masala. Simmer for another 2-3 minutes. 10. Finish with a dollop of cream and a drizzle of ghee. 11. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: Paneer (cottage cheese), onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, cashew nuts, cream, butter, kasuri methi, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, oil, ghee, salt.
Procedure: 1. Heat oil in a pan and add chopped onions. Sauté until golden brown. 2. Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies. Cook until the raw smell disappears. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and cashew nuts. Cook until tomatoes are soft. 4. Allow the mixture to cool and blend it into a smooth paste. 5. Heat butter and ghee in a pan. 6. Add the blended paste and cook until the oil separates. 7. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Mix well. 8. Add paneer cubes and kasuri methi. Cook for 5-7 minutes. 9. Add cream and garam masala. Mix gently. 10. Garnish with cream and chopped coriander leaves. 11. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Ingredients: Rice, milk, sugar, saffron strands, cardamom powder, chopped nuts (such as almonds, pistachios).
Procedure: 1. Wash and soak rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain the water and grind the rice into a coarse powder. 2. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan. 3. Add the ground rice to the boiling milk and cook on low heat until the mixture thickens. Stir continuously to prevent lumps. 4. Add sugar and cook until it dissolves completely. 5. Add saffron strands and cardamom powder for flavor. 6. Mix well and cook for another 5-7 minutes. 7. Remove from heat and allow it to cool slightly. 8. Pour the phirni into serving bowls and garnish with chopped nuts. 9. Refrigerate for a few hours until set. 10. Serve chilled as a dessert.

Ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery, coconut, milk, sugar, cardamom powder, oil for frying.
Procedure: For Outer Covering: 1. Mix rice flour with warm water to form a smooth dough. 2. Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into small cups. For Filling: 1. Heat jaggery and coconut in a pan until the jaggery melts and mixes well with the coconut. 2. Add cardamom powder and mix. 3. Fill the rice flour cups with the jaggery-coconut mixture. Cooking: 1. Heat oil in a pan for frying. 2. Fry the filled pithe until golden brown. 3. Drain excess oil and serve.

Ingredients: Flattened rice (poha), onions, potatoes, peanuts, green chilies, curry leaves, mustard seeds, turmeric powder, salt, sugar, lemon juice, coriander leaves, oil.
Procedure: 1. Rinse poha under running water and drain. 2. Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. 3. Once they crackle, add curry leaves, chopped onions, and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn translucent. 4. Add chopped potatoes and cook until they are soft. 5. Add turmeric powder, salt, and sugar. Mix well. 6. Add soaked poha and mix gently. 7. Cook for a few minutes. 8. Add lemon juice and chopped coriander leaves. 9. Serve hot.

Ingredients: Chana dal (split chickpeas), jaggery, rice flour, cardamom powder, oil for frying.
Procedure: 1. Cook chana dal until soft and drain excess water. 2. Mash the cooked chana dal and add jaggery and cardamom powder. Mix well. 3. Make small balls out of this mixture. 4. Prepare a dough using rice flour and water. 5. Flatten a small portion of the dough and place a chana dal-jaggery ball in the center. 6. Close the edges and shape them into balls again. 7. Heat oil in a pan for frying. 8. Fry the poornalu until golden brown. 9. Drain excess oil and serve.

Ingredients: Rice flour, sugar, ghee, cardamom powder.
Procedure: 1. Prepare a thin batter by mixing rice flour with water. 2. Heat a tawa and pour a ladleful of batter. 3. Spread it thinly like a crepe. 4. Cook until it turns crisp. 5. Remove from the tawa and allow it to cool slightly. 6. Sprinkle sugar and cardamom powder on top. 7. Roll the crepe tightly. 8. Heat ghee in a pan and fry the rolled crepe until golden brown. 9. Remove from heat and let it cool. 10. Serve crispy pootharekulu.

Ingredients: Dried apricots, sugar, water, saffron strands, cardamom powder, almonds, pistachios.
Procedure: 1. Soak dried apricots in water overnight. 2. Remove the seeds and chop them into small pieces. 3. Cook the chopped apricots with sugar and water until they are soft and mushy. 4. Add saffron strands and cardamom powder. Mix well. 5. Garnish with chopped almonds and pistachios. 6. Serve warm or chilled.

Ingredients: Milk, sugar, saffron strands, cardamom powder, almonds, pistachios.
Procedure: 1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan and simmer until it reduces to half the quantity. 2. Add sugar, saffron strands, and cardamom powder. Mix well. 3. Continue cooking until the milk thickens further. 4. Remove from heat and allow it to cool slightly. 5. Garnish with chopped almonds and pistachios. 6. Serve chilled.

Ingredients: Milk, lemon juice, sugar, water, cardamom powder, saffron strands, almonds, pistachios.
Procedure: For Rasgulla: 1. Boil milk and curdle it by adding lemon juice. 2. Strain the curdled milk through a muslin cloth to separate the chenna (paneer). 3. Knead the chenna until smooth and divide it into small portions. 4. Shape each portion into a smooth ball. 5. Boil sugar and water in a wide pan and add the chenna balls. 6. Cook covered for 15-20 minutes. For Ras Malai: 1. Boil milk in a pan and add sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands. 2. Simmer until the milk thickens. 3. Remove from heat and cool. 4. Soak the prepared rasgullas in the cooled milk. 5. Garnish with chopped almonds and pistachios. 6. Chill before serving.

Ingredients: Milk, lemon juice, sugar, water, cardamom powder.
Procedure: 1. Boil milk and curdle it by adding lemon juice. 2. Strain the curdled milk through a muslin cloth to separate the chenna (paneer). 3. Knead the chenna until smooth and divide it into small portions. 4. Shape each portion into a smooth ball. 5. Boil sugar and water in a wide pan and add the chenna balls. 6. Cook covered for 15-20 minutes. 7. Remove from heat and cool. 8. Serve chilled.

Ingredients: Chenna (paneer), sugar, cardamom powder, saffron strands, chopped nuts (such as almonds, pistachios).
Procedure: 1. Knead chenna until smooth. 2. Add sugar and cardamom powder. Mix well. 3. Shape the mixture into small discs or balls. 4. Garnish with saffron strands and chopped nuts. 5. Chill for a few hours before serving.

Ingredients: All-purpose flour, semolina (sooji), ghee, sugar, milk, cardamom powder, oil for frying.
Procedure: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, semolina, ghee, sugar, cardamom powder, and milk to make a stiff dough. 2. Knead the dough well and let it rest for 15-20 minutes. 3. Roll out the dough into a thick sheet and cut into diamond or square shapes using a knife or cookie cutter. 4. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying. 5. Deep fry the shankarpalis on medium heat until golden brown and crispy. 6. Drain excess oil on paper towels and let them cool completely before storing in an airtight container.

Ingredients: Vermicelli, milk, sugar, ghee, mixed nuts (such as almonds, cashews, pistachios), dates, raisins, cardamom powder, saffron strands.
Procedure: 1. Heat ghee in a pan and roast the vermicelli until golden brown. 2. Add milk and cook until the vermicelli is soft and the milk thickens slightly. 3. Add sugar and mix well until dissolved. 4. Add chopped mixed nuts, dates, raisins, cardamom powder, and saffron strands. 5. Simmer for a few more minutes until the flavors are well combined. 6. Serve hot or chilled.

Ingredients: Semolina (sooji), ghee, sugar, water, cardamom powder, saffron strands, mixed nuts (such as almonds, cashews, pistachios), raisins.
Procedure: 1. Heat ghee in a pan and roast semolina until golden brown and aromatic. 2. In another pan, heat water and sugar until the sugar dissolves completely. 3. Slowly add the sugar syrup to the roasted semolina while stirring continuously to avoid lumps. 4. Add cardamom powder and saffron strands for flavor. 5. Cook until the sheera thickens and starts to leave the sides of the pan. 6. Add chopped mixed nuts and raisins. 7. Mix well and remove from heat. 8. Serve hot.

Ingredients: Hung curd (strained yogurt), sugar, saffron strands, cardamom powder, mixed nuts (such as almonds, pistachios), rose water (optional).
Procedure: 1. Hang the curd in a muslin cloth for a few hours to remove excess whey and obtain thick hung curd. 2. In a mixing bowl, combine hung curd, sugar, saffron strands, and cardamom powder. 3. Mix well until sugar dissolves and the mixture becomes smooth and creamy. 4. Add chopped mixed nuts and a few drops of rose water for fragrance (if using). 5. Chill the shrikhand in the refrigerator for a couple of hours before serving. 6. Serve chilled as a dessert.

Ingredients: Cornflour, ghee, sugar, water, cardamom powder, mixed nuts (such as almonds, cashews, pistachios), saffron strands.
Procedure: 1. Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan and roast cornflour until aromatic. 2. In another pan, prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water until it reaches a thick consistency. 3. Slowly add the sugar syrup to the roasted cornflour while stirring continuously to avoid lumps. 4. Cook over low heat until the mixture thickens and leaves the sides of the pan. 5. Add cardamom powder and mix well. 6. Add chopped mixed nuts and saffron strands. 7. Pour the mixture into a greased plate and spread evenly. 8. Let it cool completely and set. 9. Cut into pieces and serve.

Ingredients: Gram flour (besan), ghee, sugar, water, cardamom powder, mixed nuts (such as almonds, cashews, pistachios).
Procedure: 1. Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan and roast gram flour until golden brown and aromatic. 2. In another pan, prepare sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water until it reaches a thick consistency. 3. Slowly add the sugar syrup to the roasted gram flour while stirring continuously to avoid lumps. 4. Cook over low heat until the mixture thickens and leaves the sides of the pan. 5. Add cardamom powder and mix well. 6. Add chopped mixed nuts and mix again. 7. Pour the mixture onto a greased surface and spread it evenly using a greased rolling pin. 8. Let it cool slightly and cut into square or diamond shapes. 9. Allow it to cool completely and store in an airtight container.

Ingredients: Refined flour (maida), ghee, sugar, water, cardamom powder.
Procedure: 1. Knead the refined flour with water to make a soft dough. 2. Divide the dough into small portions and roll out each portion into thin strips. 3. Heat ghee in a deep pan for frying. 4. Fry the rolled strips in hot ghee until golden brown and crisp. 5. Remove from the ghee and drain excess oil. 6. Dip the fried strips into sugar syrup for a few seconds. 7. Remove from the syrup and sprinkle cardamom powder on top. 8. Allow it to cool completely before serving.

Ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery, mashed banana, grated coconut, cardamom powder, ghee, baking soda, water.
Procedure: 1. In a bowl, mix rice flour, grated coconut, mashed banana, cardamom powder, and melted jaggery. 2. Add water gradually to form a thick batter. 3. Heat the appam pan and grease the molds with ghee. 4. Add a pinch of baking soda to the batter and mix well. 5. Pour the batter into the molds. 6. Cook on low flame until the appams turn golden brown and crispy on both sides. 7. Remove from the pan and serve hot.
